column4: Bluelf: if you press ALT+F2 and start typing its name does it complete?
Bluelf: then i'd run alacarte and make your own entry in the menu as well as log a bug
Bluelf: once you make the menu entry you can copy it to the desktop if you wish
Bluelf: ok, launch it from terminal for clues. I don't know the app but I can suggest generic stuff

its like keynote , its for presentations

ah its justok , nothing compared to powerpoint 2010 or keynote
i'd ask in #compiz ,its more specific to you issue
being "up to date" means your RELEASE is up to date, it doesn't mean you are on the latest release
karmic was released in 2009 and is still supported and will say "up to date" but isn't maverick
had already changed release upgrade to normal release but still when I click on check it says that my system is up-to-date..
it's more involved than using apt-get
check the upgrade notes ubottu gave, it has commands to run
ok
it tells me to do same things that I have tried, I tried again nothing happened
sudo apt-get install update-manager-core; sudo do-release-upgrade
thanks :)
all i did was copy the command from the upgrade notes ubottu gave
it was in the section "Network Upgrade for Ubuntu Servers (Recommended)" I tried what was written for Ubuntu Desktops.
the server upgrade just involves tryping stuff as it doesn't have the gui stuff the desktop has
I dint knew. Typing stuff is much easier..next time i will try server commands first .. thanks
np man, terminal == power :D
